page.title: 07WALKING ON THE NORTH MOOR
page.content: After the sharp climb out of Okehampton on to the moor, through the area proposed for the southern by-pass route, the moor stands before us. Once past moor gate the next buildings southwards are those of Princetown in the middle of the moor. The northern moor provides some good walking, the area being relatively free of the bogs and includes a variety of Tors. Once out of sight of the camp and lowland areas one is in true wildscape. On the eastern side of the area the loop road (see another page) gives easy access for those who do not like the climb up to the moor; so occasionally one may come across a car out on the wilds of the moor. There is a great reward for the climb to Yes Tor's rocky summit with, on a clear day, Exmoor and most of N. Devon in view. 'Proper job'!
